text: Colombia competed at the 2015 UCI Track Cycling World Championships in Saint- Quentin-en-Yvelines at the Vélodrome de Saint-Quentin-en-Yvelines from 18–22 February 2015. A team of 14 cyclists (5 women, 9 men) was announced to represent the country in the event. ==Results== ===Men=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Name !Event !Result !Rank |- | Anderson Parra || Men's sprint || 10.048||align=center|28 |- | Fabian Puerta || Men's sprint || ||align=center|DNS |- | Fabián Puerta || Men's 1 km time trial ||1:00.907||align=center|5 |- | Anderson Parra || Men's 1 km time trial ||1:02.126||align=center|15 |- | Edwin Ávila || Men's points race ||4 points||align=center|16 |- | Fernando Gaviria || Men's omnium ||205 points||align=center| |- | Fabián Puerta || Men's keirin ||||align=center|7 |- | Anderson Parra || Men's keirin ||||align=center|17 |- | Juan Arango Weimar Roldán || Men's madison ||5 points||align=center|10 |- | Fernando Gaviria Edwin Ávila Juan Arango Weimar Roldán || Men's team pursuit ||4:03.908||align=center|12 |- | Ruben Murillo Anderson Parra Julian Suárez || Men's team sprint ||44.865||align=center|16 |} Sources ===Women=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Name !Event !Result !Rank |- | Diana García || Women's sprint || 11.286||align=center|25 |- | Juliana Gaviria || Women's sprint || 11.307||align=center|26 |- | Juliana Gaviria || Women's 500 m time trial ||35.123||align=center|16 |- | María Luisa Calle || Women's individual pursuit ||3:39.592||align=center|12 |- | María Luisa Calle || Women's points race ||3 points||align=center|13 |- | Jannie Salcedo || Women's scratch ||||align=center|9 |- | Martha Bayona Juliana Gaviria || Women's team sprint ||34.458||align=center|10 |- | Juliana Gaviria || Women's keirin ||||align=center|17 |} Sources Colombia competed at the 2016 UCI Track Cycling World Championships at the Lee Valley VeloPark in London, United Kingdom from 2–4 March 2016. A team of 7 cyclists (2 women, 5 men) was announced to represent the country in the event. ==Results== ===Men=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Name !Event !Result !Rank |- | Fabian Hernando Puerta Zapata|| Men's sprint || ||align=center|5 |- | Santiago Ramirez Morales|| Men's sprint || ||align=center|30 |- | Santiago Ramirez Morales|| Men's 1 km time trial ||01:02.207||align=center|9 |- | Fabian Hernando Puerta Zapata|| Men's keirin ||||align=center|17 |- | Jordan Parra Fernando Gaviria || Men's madison ||6 points||align=center|6 |} Sources ===Women=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Name !Event !Result !Rank |- | Juliana Gaviria Rendon|| Women's sprint || ||align=center|21 |- | Martha Bayona Pineda|| Women's sprint || ||align=center|26 |- | Martha Bayona Pineda|| Women's 500 m time trial ||34.903 sec ||align=center|12 |- | Martha Bayona Juliana Gaviria|| Women's team sprint ||34.171 ||align=center|11 |} Sources ==References== Category:Colombia at cycling events
title: Colombia at the UCI Track Cycling World Championships
